col2: The first church dates from 1599. The second church, built in 1605, was replaced by a third in 1641. In 1703 the town was transferred to Lumangbayan, but the earthquakes and floods of 1743 destroyed the church and the town and caused the people to transfer to the present site. The present church was built in 1748.
col4: National Historical Commission of the Philippines

col0: Fort of San Antonio Abad historical marker
col1: Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas Complex, Roxas Boulevard
col2: The origin of this fort dates from 1584. It was captured by the British in 1762 and rebuilt at the beginning of the nineteenth century, when it was called La Polvorista because it was used as powder magazine. The first battalion of the First Colorado Regiment, under the command of Lt. Col. McCoy, took possession of this fort and hoisted the American flag over it on August 13, 1898.
col4: National Historical Commission of the Philippines
